sub_title: 🌱 Data Nerd 🌱 Nature Freek 🌱 Food Lover 🌱 Dance Practitioner 🌱 Music Enthusiast 🌱 Pet Lady 🌱 DIY-er 🌱 Energy Healer 🌱
summary:
My background lies in Applied Physics. Both my bachelor and master theses focussed on the world of bionanoscience. My work experience at Krohne teached me about the oil industry and how to make a product from the drawing table until the actual production. In parallel I learned and worked with Agile Scrum, even becoming a Scrum Master. My hobbies involve crafting, animals, dancing and cooking. My passion lies with the environment, how to look after it and how it can keep me healthy (I love my vegatable garden and working with herbs) and with the holistic view on healing. The ultimate goal would be to connect my interest and skills in data engineering with these passions. 

I like working in an organized manner and completing things before moving on. Don't mind to work on a independent project for a while, but I feel that people working in a team can help grow each other and produce more increments. I am an open person and will give it to you straight. Please return the favor. I am here to learn. Forever. 

Interested in working together? At the moment I am good with BAM and also on maternity leave.



Note to recruiters (1): I will not spend time on replying messages that are only describing a new job or asking for a CV without any personal interaction/conversation.

Note to recruiters (2): I am not interested in working at a consultancy.

Note to people who want to connect: If we did not meet in person or had no conversation what so ever, I will not accept your invitation.

profile_positions.description:
Started with building and maintaining the data backend of multiple projects (+10), ranging from showing raw data in Power BI visualizations up to and including making complex calculations and predictive models in the Azure Portal with the use of languages like SQL, C#, R and Python. 
Currently working on the Clarity project, which is a general solution that combines multiple information flows into one overview which facilitates performance dialogues for project performance. It is built on our BAM Data Analytics Platform in Azure (+35 developers), where I am in the lead for two major source systems. 

Keep on learning!
- Azure Fundamentals AZ-900 (passed the exam 21-05-2021)
     https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/certifications/exams/az-900
     https://www.udemy.com/certificate/UC-03f4d15c-900c-4ec2-b741-e8f59efb6512/

- Azure Developer AZ-204 (passed the exam 17-08-2021)
     https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/certifications/exams/az-204
     https://www.udemy.com/certificate/UC-19e21789-9430-4e68-bcfb-fbefb3471b41/

- Azure Data Fundamentals DP-900 (passed the exam 01-10-2021)
     https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/certifications/exams/dp-900
     https://www.udemy.com/certificate/UC-5fdf5792-5079-43d6-ad9a-d06eb5fd18cf/

- Azure Data Engineer DP-203 (passed the exam 20-12-2022)
     https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/certifications/exams/dp-203
     https://www.udemy.com/certificate/UC-41d8f6ad-400e-4b9d-b43e-437c58e0dcbe/
profile_positions.title: Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Joined the BI&Analytics team (4 FTE) of the Information Management department with the goal to development and improve current and new (big) data-driven services. Most of these services are in the Azure Portal combined with PowerBI dashboards. Part of the Portal is under my supervision and I am in the process of bringing the services from this environment to production, which includes rework to lower costs and improve speed. In the meanwhile the first new projects present themselves and give me the oppertunity to put my learnings from the past few months into practice. 

In the time working at BAM, I already worked together with quite a lot of people and on quite a number of different projects. Data from different sources, discovering all different aspects within the Azure Portal (Databricks, Data Factory, Virtual Machines, SQL databases, App Services, Logic Apps) and still learning more about Power BI. In the mean time I also continued to develop my coding skills, mostly on SQL and C#.

Extra courses:
- C# beginner/intermediate/advanced training
profile_positions.title: Junior Data Engineer/Scientist (Big Data Trainee of Working Talent)

profile_positions.description:
On 15 october I started my Big Data traineeship with Working Talent, together with a select group of trainees. During the first 8 weeks we received a lot of training about big data, the different languages used for working with big data and trying out different tools to apply these languages. An overview of the different training courses that we done can be found here:

- Introduction to Data Science
- Data Science Research Methods: R Edition
- Principles of Machine Learning: R Edition  ( + official certificate)
- Principles of Machine Learning
- Analyzing Big Data with Microsoft R  ( + official certificate)
- Querying Data with Transact-SQL  ( + official certificate)
- Analyzing and Visualizing Data with Power BI  ( + offical certificate)
- Analytics Storytelling for Impact
- Introduction to Python: Absolute Beginner
- Introduction to Python: Fundamentals
- Introduction to Python: Creating Scalable, Robust, Interactive Code
- Programming with Python for Data Science  ( + official certificate)
- C# Basics for Beginners: Learn C# Fundamentals by Coding
profile_positions.title: Big Data Trainee

profile_positions.description:
January I started working as a Data Scientist at Witteveen+Bos via Working Talent. The main focus of my project was to create more insight into financial data with the use of visualizations and dashboards. Most of this is done in the form of Excel exports and PowerBI. 

By now this project has become part of something larger. The company is looking for a way to gather all sorts of data, in such a way that it can be used more easily for findings KPI results. I am now part of the team responsible for gathering requirements, building database schema's and inventing dashboards to help visualizing these KPI's.  

Another project is a data conversion job, where a client needs to change an Excel sheet to a RDF (Turle) file in order to import it in their database. This required a lot of data cleaning and learning about RDF and graphical databases. 

In parallel I am solving smaller questions and further developing my R, Python and Power BI skills.
profile_positions.title: Junior Data Scientist (Big Data Trainee of Working Talent)

profile_positions.description:
- Worked with 20 FTE in both English and Dutch on multiple subjects thoughout the whole process of research and product development until production and sending the product to the customer. 
  - I started my work here focussing on the maintanance and development of the magnetic part of our product. This required me to work together with the Meachanics team (3 FTE) for further development and investigations and with the Production department (3 FTE) to explain/help with the buildup of the magnet parts. During this period I learned a lot about working with people from different levels and converting highly detailed knowledge into plain English. Next to that I worked a lot with Origin and Ansys to do simulations and present the work.
  - Later the focus shifted more toward model development together with the Physics team (5 FTE). This requires me to participate in brainstorm sessions, setup experiments, running the experiments, doing data analysis, writing reports and giving presentations all to improve the models used in our product. During this time I improved my overall NMR knowledge and fluid properties knowledge. Next to that I got pretty skilled in working with Scilab and Matlab.
  - Parallel to previous described tasks, I was involved in the monthly Technical Lunch Meetings, reviewing/distributing patents related to our research, helping with the realisation of our new building, doing product calibrations at Xcaliber and overseeing experimens at external companies. These tasks helped me improve my softskills and my understanding of scientific reading/writing.

Extra courses:
- Ansys Design Modeler
- Ansys Maxwell
- Ansys Mechanical Introduction
- Robotics training
profile_positions.title: Experimental Physicist

profile_positions.description:
- Partial Scum Master of the Physics team (5 FTE) and later the whole team (20 FTE & English)
  - The main tasks consist of facilitating Scrum meetings, keep learning about Agile and provide the team with this information to reflect and upgrade their knowledge of Agile and the Scrum values. This requires me to be organized, inspired me to get creative to reach each individual, improved my skills for working together and proved that we are stronger when doing it as one. Next to that I learned to work with Jira and Jama.
  - Next to that I try to be there for the team on a more personal level and help out where it is possible. This required me to take my listening skills to the next level and learn that not everybody can be approached in the same way. I enjoyed this part of my job very much.
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master

profile_positions.description:
- Getting experience of working in a company team (20 FTE)
  - Worked closely together with the team's expert to get as much of the theoretical NMR knowledge as soon as possible and learn how to apply that in practice for running the needed experiments. These experiments were focussed on how the relaxation time of samples is related to temperature and visocity. 
  - Worked closely together with my supervisor to analyse the results, which gave us insight into how the relaxtation times evolve with temperature and led us to suggest a model to estimate the viscosity of an oil based on its log-mean relaxation time.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Assisting students with their homework and explain new concepts. 
- Working together with other assistants and the professor to grade all tests, homework and exams.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- Working together with a post doc on his experiments. Mostly preparing graphene to make graphene nanopores and graphene covered chips. 
- Assisting and teaching bachelor students (3 people) with their experiments and thesis.
profile_positions.title: Student Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
As part of the nature guide training you are encouraged to participate in a wide varaity of volunteering activities in and around IVN. For example, I organized workshops for 'Groen, Grijs en Gelukkig', which takes nature into elderly homes when the elderly cannot go outside to enjoy nature. I also helped with some workshops for the youth group 'Nature Explorers' (12-18 years). 

The highlight of 2020 was to design and build the tiny houses for the gnome forest, which we realised for our youngest participants (1-4 years). https://www.rodi.nl/regio/alphenaandenrijn/236128/er-was-eens-een-bos-vol-kabouters-

Practicing Reiki from my own home. This consists of self-treatments, to enhance the Reiki energy that I can transfer to other people, and treatments on people who are interested. Treatments also involve listening to a person and figuring out how different health issues are connected. To give the best care I continuously keep following trainings to develop myself as an allround healer.
Helping people, who are not (fully) able to, with their (vegetable) garden.

Once a month part of my family returns to the elderly home where my grandfather used to live to make music and entertain people with dance. Most of these elderly people have dementia and are no longer able to communicate. Yet music, in particular from their past, lights up some sort of recognition and makes them laugh, talk about their past and even try to dance. 

Unfortunately this stopped due to COVID.

- Managing a group of volunteers (~15 people) to improve a dance program for people with a mental disability.
  - Time managing the dance lessons in order to practice each dance and give each person the same amount of practice time on the floor (less volunteers than participants), while still keeping time for some freestyle dancing.
  - Arranging music and guest performances that speak to everyone's liking.
  - Pushing myself to be more flexible and creative, for this group of people is highly diverse and unpredictive at times. 
- Rotatively guiding all the people in this group (~35 people) by being their dancepartner, this requires flexibility and a lot of non-verbal communication for each of them has different levels of mental (and sometimes fysical) disabilities.
- Making people smile and having a good time

- Working together with the dance teacher to show and explain new pieces of choreography to different groups of dancers (~20 people per group)
- Facilitating drinks and service during the breaks.
- Being part of various dance marathons to gather money for different good causes.
